Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2015 02:00AM Novna70 wrote: Hi CobIndie, I also had neoadjuvant care. 4 rounds of A/C, 3 of Taxol (didn't have the 4th because it was not working) and 25 radiation treatments before my surgery on February 5th. My anxiety came from the discovery (almost by accident) of high blood sugar, and the possibility of the surgery being delayed! I was freaking out. I went into a super strict diet, medication and glucose measuring 4 times a day (don't miss that many pricks). I was in a zone! I needed the cancer out of me. Try to concentrate on something else and put your energy and/or faith on the positive result of the surgery. You will be cancer free soon! I know it's not easy and I hope you have strong support from family and friends. I wish you a speedy recovery. Godspeed!
Posts.Title: Feeling Nervous Coblndie Novna70
